page.title: 06SHOTESHAM/HOWE FARMING 3
page.content: {SOIL TYPES}are London, Jurassic clay and medium loam. Some fields are drained. Soil improvers used are manure and chemical fertilizers Hedges are cut and ditches cleared to promote good drainage. In woodland the pathways are trimmed and dead wood felled. {PONDS}occur frequently in the fields, some natural and others were originally dug out to provide water for cattle and horses. The clay lump was used as a building material. {FIELD SIZES}in the area, are generally less than 15 acres with only one of 30 acres. A farm of 330 acres has 16 miles of hedges and ditches. 25 years ago 10 men were necessary to run a farm worked today by 2 men. Yields are tripled with aid from plant breeders and use of machinery.
